result.execSummary:
The defendant Abigail Rose Knoll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 
Provide DNA sample.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment and Attend school/obtain HSED - any combination.
Expungement under 973.015 upon; Successful completion of probation.

records.addlTxt:
3:43 PM Defendant Abigail Rose Knoll in court, in custody.  Attorney Shelley Cupino in court for Abigail Rose Knoll.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
Atty Cupino puts plea agreement on the record - Deft to plead Guilty or No Contest to 1 Count and remaining Counts to be DRI. Deft is not getting revoked from current Probation, so State is recommending 24 months Probation with 90 days conditional jail with an additional 90 days jail imposed/stayed. Conditions as stated on the record and Defense free to argue.
Deft pleads No Contest to Count 1 - Court finds Guilty and Counts 2 and 3 are Dismissed and Read in.
State makes sentencing argument.
Defense joins recommendation for Probation but requesting imposed/stayed sentence and makes sentencing argument. 69 days credit.
Deft makes statement to Court.
Court orders 24 months Probation with 90 days jail imposed/stayed, conditions as stated on the record and Expungement upon successful completion of Probation.
Elements

9:46 AM Defendant Abigail Rose Knoll appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by phone for Abigail Rose Knoll.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. State is in compliance w/victim's rights. Defense motion to amend cash bond down to a signature bond and contact condition to no violent or abusive. Defendant is not being revoked off of probation. State objects to cash modification and lift of residence contact, but does support no violent or abusive contact. Court denies bond modification as requested. Defense has an offer and would like to resolve. Court removes SC and sets for plea.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.
